docs.text: Web Accessibility ¶ What is it ¶ Making websites usable for as many people as possible Accessibility is not an edge case. If you had 1000 employees and one was a wheelchair user, you'd provide an access ramp. We don't get to deprioritize based on % of users - this is not about product/market fit, it's about inclusive services that work for everybody Why care? ¶ ~20% of people have a disability design principle applied to make a site accessible can affect all people positively might help with SEO if done right it's the law Users/Situations to consider ¶ Vision related disabilities ¶ Blind users Low vision Colour blind user People with glasses or visual impairments Bad Lighting/Sun Glare Users who use screen readers Users who only use only keyboard Hearing related disabilities ¶ Deafness Hard-of-hearing Physical Disabilities ¶ Lack of motor control Speech troubles Users who use assistive technology that only uses keyboard Cognitive/Neurological Disabilities ¶ Memory/learning related ADHD/focus//distractibility related perception related problem solving related Urgency of situation that clouds cognitive ability Sezius and other psychiatric disabilities Temporary Disabilities ¶ Broken limbs, fingers Common Disabilities: ¶ Carpel Tunnel Arthritis Age related deterioration Technical considerations ¶ Slow Internet Screen Size Using Legacy technology

docs.text: ASP.Net 4 Web Forms ¶ .NET Framework ¶ C# is the .NET framework language A software library with a runtime environment (for execution) Does memory management like java Use common language runtime (CLR) to execute code Tools: ¶ IDE: Visual Studio HelloWorld - Console App ¶ //main.cs using System ; class MainClass { public static void Main ( string [] args ) { Console . WriteLine ( "Hello World" ); Console . ReadKey (); } } Solution ¶ A group of several projects (eg. Windows Forms app + Website) Namespaces ¶ Grouping of spaces that have something similar to each other Java equivalent: package names? Methods ¶ Access Modifiers: private, public, protected, internal, protected internal accessModifier returnType methodName (returnType param1, returnType param2){} Static ¶ static methods can only access other static methods from within the same class accessModifier [optional static] returnType methodName (returnType param1, returnType param2){} Debugging for VS ¶ Continue - F5 Step into - F11 Step over - F10
